title: Why Jaggery?
subtitle: The Sweet Truth About Natural Sweeteners

sections.title: What is Jaggery?
sections.content: Jaggery, also known as 'gur' in Hindi, is an unrefined sugar made from sugarcane juice or palm sap. Unlike white sugar, jaggery retains its natural minerals and nutrients during the minimal processing it undergoes.

sections.title: Nutritional Benefits
sections.content: Jaggery is rich in iron, magnesium, potassium, and calcium. It also contains antioxidants and has a lower glycemic index compared to refined sugar, making it a better choice for blood sugar management.

sections.title: Why We Choose Jaggery
sections.content: We use jaggery not just for its health benefits, but also for its unique flavor profile. It adds a rich, caramel-like sweetness that enhances the overall taste of our cookies while providing natural nutrition.

sections.title: The Thekua Connection
sections.content: Thekua is a traditional Indian cookie from Bihar and Jharkhand, traditionally made during festivals. Our modern take on this classic recipe uses jaggery as the primary sweetener, staying true to its roots while making it healthier.
